page.title: 13PLACE NAMES, BURSTON AREA
page.content: BURSTON: Burgstan's town or Tun BUTTERHILL: Meadow on a slight elevation where cows were kept and butter made CRAG'S TAIL: The end of a rocky outcrop DAYHILLS: Deyes or cowherds, hills for the keeping of livestock HARDIWICK: Herd farm, Wick or Wic, for the flock HOLLYWOOD: The wood of the holly trees LITTLE STOKE: The stockaded place or military depot of the English Forces THE ORANGE HAYES: The High Range Heyes, a forest or woodland SANDY LEYS: Untilled sandy pastures SMALLRICE or RISE: A small rise of ground
